supportDesc.condition: The sewing has been crudely repaired with modern synthetic threads. The textblock is held together by stitch repairs. Some leaves are slightly stained with water: fols. 137, 138, 153v, 154r, 155v, 156r. A few words are illegible or barely legible on fol. 1rb, ls. 9-11. Cuts amended on fols. 16, 76, 77, 86, 89, 133, 148, 153, 156.

layout.ab: Number of lines varies from 24 (e.g., fol. 77va) to 36 (e.g., fol. 59va).
The upper line is written above the ruling (sometimes below the ruling: e.g., fols. 97v, 119v, 120r, 141r).
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The arrangement of the columns is rather unstable.
The scribe sometimes did not use the last ruled line: e.g., fols. 6v, 15r, 22r, 28v, 31v, 34v.
The upper line is written above the ruling (sometimes below the ruling: e.g., fols. 35v-44r).
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The arrangement of the columns is rather unstable.
The scribe did not use the first ruled line on fol. 50v.

handNote.seg: Black (deep reddish brown on fols. 46ra l.16-48rb l. 9), red

handDesc.handNote: Hand a: fols. 1r-34v, 58r-156r, broadly spaced letters (except fols. 24va-26vb, 28ra-34ra, 58r-74v) with curved left-sloping letter shapes.
- ደ has the 6th order marker slanted to the left
- የ has the 7th order marker usually slanted to the left
- the loop marking the 5th order is sometimes open.
Hand b: fols. 35r-57v, characterized by angular right-sloping letter shapes.
It is possible that another hand was involved in the writing (s. e.g., fols. 58r-74v).
- the upper horizontal stroke of መ is usually slanted to the left
- ፀ has a rectangular shape, esp. in the 5th order
- መ has the loops usually not separated, esp. in the 4th order.

decoDesc.decoNote: Several lines alternating with black lines on the incipit page; several lines alternating with black lines on the incipit page of each section; the name of Mary on fol. 120ra; names of the feasts in the upper margin of the fols.; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
f. 1r (incipit page of Text I-1): elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, blue, outlined in black) ornamental frame, with a horizontal band reaching the top pf the page; interlaces, crosses.
f. 9r (incipit page of Text I-4): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, white, green, outlined in black) ornamental band, crosses, interlaces, three vertical pendants reaching ls. 7-8;
f. 73r: (incipit page of Text I-19): elaborate coloured (red, yellow, outlined in black) ornamental band; interlaces.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

Spine protection made of two pieces of vivid rose leather. Two pairs of chains of the endband stitches at the spine protection, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex. Most of the quires are reinforced by leather guards.
